text: Internet phenom Matthew Newland causes
chaos by dropping red hot nickel balls
to anything he can get his hands on
crayons to honey so far have an
incredible million but our experts just
love seeing a red hot nickel ball in
cold what's with all the strange sci-fi
sounds what's happened here is that the
nickel ball is so hot is created a layer
of water vapor the layer of gas forms
little bubbles and because gas is
lighter than water it rises to the
surface as these bubbles rise they cool
and so the bubble begins to shrink as
each bubble closes in it emits the air
in a very rapid form and these
vibrations propagate through the water
to the surface and they hit the air that
sets the air vibrating and that's what
exactly what we perceive a sound
eventually the nickel ball cools down so
much that the steam layer collapses
causing a cascade of tiny bubbles which
we hear as a wish
